requests.essay_b_text:
Prov: SA24 Eng5 NP Writing: Role Models
ES24
Antal ord: 589
Role models
Everyone has some kind of role model in their life, someone who affects their choices and values. A role model is someone you look up to, maybe someone you want to be. To have a role model in your life can affect you both in an positive or negative way, I would deffinetaly say that it depends on who the person in question is. 
When we were in first grade, all my friends wanted to be like all the tiktok famous girls who danced, got free products and looked amazing. Their lifestyle seemed to be spotless and
 even tho we were so little and still had our entire childhood left, we wanted to be exactly like them. Now I look back and find it kinda sad that seven year olds wanted to have the same look and life as twentyfive year old grown women who probably edited their pictures and videos. But at that time, they seemed so perfect and it made you question yourself in an unhealthy way. I think that was the first time I started to doubt myself and my own looks, the pressure to be skinny and perfect got put in our head
s as seven years old girls.
A role model can also be great for you, it could be someone who really inspires you and your goals. It could be a person who works with your dreamjob, for an example a rockstar or a writer. If your idol has something you really want and helps you to reach that goal in a healthy way, I think it´s a great way to grow as human. The role model could also be our parents, I can only speak for myself but I think that most of the people recognize themself when I say that our parents we
re the first persons we looked up to. They seemed to always be right and I just assumed that everything they said was correct, that they always wanted my best and that they would always be on my side as a safe place to go. This was in some ways right, I know that my parents will always be there for me but I can´t assume that they magically will fix my life everything something gets hard. That´s not how life works, we have to be our own person at some point and I´ve realized that my parents aren´t perfect. 
My role model isn´t a famous person, an influencer or even my parents. It´s the same person who was with me in first grade when we first started to doubt ourselfs, when life suddenly felt hard and everything got real, my best friend. She has been with me since three years old and we got thru everything together. We´ve shared our life with eachother to the point where it feels like her life is mine and my life is hers. When something great happens to her, Im just as happy as her and when something bad happ
ens, I´m right by her side to give her comfort. My best friend knows me better than anyone and she´s always there for me no matter what. I think that it´s really important to look around and see everything you have and all the persons who cares about instead of always reaching for the 
"perfect" life and the unhealty ideal. Everything and everyone we need is most often around us and your true role model can be closer than you think.
requests.user_prompt:
**Student Assignment:**
Role Models
Role models are looked up to and admired for who they are or for what they do. They may be politicians, inventors, celebrities, teachers, athletes, activists, coaches, or even family members. The spring issue of the online magazine Right NOW! will focus on role models. The magazine is inviting you to write a text about role models.

Word Count: The essay should be at least 250 words but not more than 600 words. Make sure you have time to check what you have written. 

Write a text about how role models in general may influence and affect people, and also about someone that you yourself look up to. Use some or all of the following points when planning and writing your text. You can also use the pictures for inspiration. 

Explain - Give examples - Discuss - State your opinions 

What different (kinds of) role models do people have nowadays? Why?
How do role models in general influence people? Values? Attitudes? Lifestyles?
What responsibilities do you think role models have?
Who is your own role model? Introduce him/her.
Why do you respect this person?
How does your role model influence you/others?
How can role models -yours and other people's - help create a better society? 

**Assessment Criteria:**

**Student Assignment:**

Role models are looked up to and admired for who they are or for what they do. They may be politicians, inventors, celebrities, teachers, athletes, activists, coaches, or even family members. The spring issue of the online magazine Right NOW! will focus on role models. The magazine is inviting you to write a text about role models.

Word Count: The essay should be at least 250 words but not more than 600 words. Make sure you have time to check what you have written. 

Write a text about how role models in general may influence and affect people, and also about someone that you yourself look up to. Use some or all of the following points when planning and writing your text. You can also use the pictures for inspiration. 

Explain - Give examples - Discuss - State your opinions 

What different (kinds of) role models do people have nowadays? Why?
How do role models in general influence people? Values? Attitudes? Lifestyles?
What responsibilities do you think role models have?
Who is your own role model? Introduce him/her.
Why do you respect this person?
How does your role model influence you/others?
How can role models -yours and other people's - help create a better society?

requests.essay_b_text:
Eng5 NP Writing: Role Models
EK24001@harryda.se
Antal ord: 544
There Is a lot of different kinds of role models nowadays . The ones I've heard of the most are athletes, celebrities and parents, Is your role model one of these? If it they're not what category do they fit in? I think these diffrent kinds are the most popular because of the hope they can give. these people are those who say to never give up on your dreams and always fight, especially parents. Sadly there are a lot of parents who don't push there children to get better and reach for there goals, there are even parents who can't do that. That's why I think the famous people who has a lot of admierers have to really have to keep telling people to reach for their goals and fight for what they want because I think If you really want something bad, you are going to get that.
Role models can change someone very much I would say. They often say things such as "Never give up" or "Always work towards your dreams" which gives you motivation and sometimes dicipline. These things form you as a person, I personally think that If your role model Is a humble and good person you can and will also be that. Role models form our society because every single one that reads this text looks up to someone whether they want to or not. Do you think you look up to a good role model that will change you In a posetive way?
I think most role models have more responsebility than they think and don't always think before acting and I don't think It Is easy knowing you are a role model especially for famous people. But I think that It should be more talked about from the people who know they have a lot of people that admire them.  
My greatest role model is my uncle, I do have a lot of role models and I think that most of you readers also do but my uncle Kalle is the one person I really look up to. Karl August Oppäng called "Kalle" is 23 years old and he lives In sweden gothenburg. Kalle Is one of the few people In my life that always belived In me whatever I wanted to do. He Is also my role model because he fails over and over again till he wins. He never quit and that is why I look up to him. 
I think It Is very important to have a "Kalle" in your life because you never know what life throws at you and It Is important to always have someone who pushes you and brings you motivation. Do you feel like you have a a person like this or maybe you even feel like you are this person.
I think that role models change the world both posetively and negatively. There are people who look up to terorist and there are people who look up to god, very diffrent right? Do you think that you look up to someone that makes you better, smarter or stronger. 
Now that I have said what I think, I want you to think about what makes your role model good or bad and how they have changed you.

requests.essay_b_text:
Eng5 NP Writing: Role Models
ER24004@harryda.se
Antal ord: 355
Role models
A 
roll
 model is someone you look up to, you often let that person influence you and affect you in different ways and sometimes you may not even notice it. A role model can for example be a family member or a famous person. I think everyone has an important role, everyone should always act like a good role model. Do you look up to someone? Who? Why do you look up to that person?
I think the role models people have nowadays is the persons that shows respect to others, someone who has the abillity to influence people and change their opinions to the better. But a lot of people has  someone who stands them close as a role model, like their mother, father, grandparents, or siblings. I would say it's because you've grown up with them, they've shown you how to do things, teached you things that was important then but also is important now, and they've always been your biggest supporters even tho it may not always seem like it. 
Role models influences people in different ways, but if you look up to someone, that person often has a hold on you and is able to affect such things as opinions, attitude and life style, basically how you are as a person and what you do. If your role model dresses in a special way, you may start dressing like that to.
My role model is my grandmother, that's because she's the sweetest, strongest, most caring person i know. She always shows respect to others, and she always puts everyones needs before hers. Everytime you need help or maybe just company, she's there and supports you no matter what. When my grandfather was in the hospital, she would be there for her family, even tho she was the one who needed the support from us. Ever since I was little, she's been by my side, and she's always been, and will always be my best friend.
I hope this text tells you what a role model is, how they matter for people, and how they affect young and older people.

There Is a lot of different kinds of role models nowadays . The ones I've heard of the most are athletes, celebrities and parents, Is your role model one of these? I think these diffrent kinds are the most popular because of the hope they can give. these people are those who say to never give up on your dreams and always fight, especially parents. Sadly there are a lot of parents who don't push there children to get better and reach for there goals, there are even parents who can't do that. That's why I think the famous people who has a lot of admierers have to really have to keep telling people to reach for their goals and fight for what they want because I think If you really want something bad, you are going to get that.
Role models can change someone very much I would say. They often say things such as "Never give up" or "Always work towards your dreams" which gives you motivation and sometimes dicipline. These things form you as a person, I personally think that If your role model Is a humble and good person you can and will also be that. Role models form our society because every single one that reads this text looks up to someone whether they want to or not. Do you think you look up to a good role model that will change you In a posetive way?
I think most role models have more responsebility than they think and don't always think before acting and I don't think It Is easy knowing you are a role model especially for famous people. But I think that It should be more talked about from the people who know they have a lot of people that admire them.  
My greatest role model is my uncle, I do have a lot of role models and I think that most of you readers also do but my uncle Kalle is the one person I really look up to. Karl August Oppäng called "Kalle" is 23 years old and he lives In sweden gothenburg. Kalle Is one of the few people In my life that always belived In me whatever I wanted to do. He Is also my role model because he fails over and over again till he wins. He never quit and that is why I look up to him. 
I think It Is very important to have a "Kalle" in your life because you never know what life throws at you and It Is important to always have someone who pushes you and brings you motivation. Do you feel like you have a a person like this or maybe you even feel like you are this person.
I think that role models change the world both posetively and negatively. There are people who look up to terorist and there are people who look up to god, very diffrent right? Do you think that you look up to someone that makes you better, smarter or stronger. 
Now that I have said what I think, I want you to think about what makes your role model good or bad and how they have changed you.

requests.essay_b_text:
Prov: SA24 Eng5 NP Writing: Role Models
ES24
Antal ord: 589
Role models
Everyone has some kind of role model in their life, someone who affects their choices and values. A role model is someone you look up to, maybe someone you want to be. To have a role model in your life can affect you both in an positive or negative way, I would deffinetaly say that it depends on who the person in question is. 
When we were in first grade, all my friends wanted to be like all the tiktok famous girls who danced, got free products and looked amazing. Their lifestyle seemed to be spotless and
 even tho we were so little and still had our entire childhood left, we wanted to be exactly like them. Now I look back and find it kinda sad that seven year olds wanted to have the same look and life as twentyfive year old grown women who probably edited their pictures and videos. But at that time, they seemed so perfect and it made you question yourself in an unhealthy way. I think that was the first time I started to doubt myself and my own looks, the pressure to be skinny and perfect got put in our head
s as seven years old girls.
A role model can also be great for you, it could be someone who really inspires you and your goals. It could be a person who works with your dreamjob, for an example a rockstar or a writer. Antal ord: 589
Role models
Everyone has some kind of role model in their life, someone who affects their choices and values. A role model is someone you look up to, maybe someone you want to be. To have a role model in your life can affect you both in an positive or negative way, I would deffinetaly say that it depends on who the person in question is. 
When we were in first grade, all my friends wanted to be like all the tiktok famous girls who danced, got free products and looked amazing. Their lifestyle seemed to be spotless and
 even tho we were so little and still had our entire childhood left, we wanted to be exactly like them. Now I look back and find it kinda sad that seven year olds wanted to have the same look and life as twentyfive year old grown women who probably edited their pictures and videos. But at that time, they seemed so perfect and it made you question yourself in an unhealthy way. I think that was the first time I started to doubt myself and my own looks, the pressure to be skinny and perfect got put in our head
s as seven years old girls.
A role model can also be great for you, it could be someone who really inspires you and your goals. It could be a person who works with your dreamjob, for an example a rockstar or a writer. If your idol has something you really want and helps you to reach that goal in a healthy way, I think it´s a great way to grow as human. The role model could also be our parents, I can only speak for myself but I think that most of the people recognize themself when I say that our parents we
re the first persons we looked up to. They seemed to always be right and I just assumed that everything they said was correct, that they always wanted my best and that they would always be on my side as a safe place to go. This was in some ways right, I know that my parents will always be there for me but I can´t assume that they magically will fix my life everything something gets hard. That´s not how life works, we have to be our own person at some point and I´ve realized that my parents aren´t perfect. 
My role model isn´t a famous person, an influencer or even my parents. It´s the same person who was with me in first grade when we first started to doubt ourselfs, when life suddenly felt hard and everything got real, my best friend. She has been with me since three years old and we got thru everything together. We´ve shared our life with eachother to the point where it feels like her life is mine and my life is hers. When something great happens to her, Im just as happy as her and when something bad happ
ens, I´m right by her side to give her comfort. My best friend knows me better than anyone and she´s always there for me no matter what. I think that it´s really important to look around and see everything you have and all the persons who cares about instead of always reaching for the 
"perfect" life and the unhealty ideal. Everything and everyone we need is most often around us and your true role model can be closer than you think.

requests.essay_b_text:
Eng5 NP Writing: Role Models
ER24004@harryda.se
Antal ord: 355
Role models
A 
roll
 model is someone you look up to, you often let that person influence you and affect you in different ways and sometimes you may not even notice it. A role model can for example be a family member or a famous person. I think everyone has an important role, everyone should always act like a good role model. Do you look up to someone? Who? Why do you look up to that person?
I think the role models people have nowadays is the persons that shows respect to others, someone who has the abillity to influence people and change their opinions to the better. But a lot of people has  someone who stands them close as a role model, like their mother, father, grandparents, or siblings. I would say it's because you've grown up with them, they've shown you how to do things, teached you things that was important then but also is important now, and they've always been your biggest supporters even tho it may not always seem like it. 
Role models influences people in different ways, but if you look up to someone, that person often has a hold on you and is able to affect such things as opinions, attitude and life style, basically how you are as a person and what you do. If your role model dresses in a special way, you may start dressing like that to.
My role model is my grandmother, that's because she's the sweetest, strongest, most caring person i know. She always shows respect to others, and she always puts everyones needs before hers. Everytime you need help or maybe just company, she's there and supports you no matter what. When my grandfather was in the hospital, she would be there for her family, even tho she was the one who needed the support from us. Ever since I was little, she's been by my side, and she's always been, and will always be my best friend.
I hope this text tells you what a role model is, how they matter for people, and how they affect young and older people.

Antal ord: 589
Role models
Everyone has some kind of role model in their life, someone who affects their choices and values. A role model is someone you look up to, maybe someone you want to be. To have a role model in your life can affect you both in an positive or negative way, I would deffinetaly say that it depends on who the person in question is. 
When we were in first grade, all my friends wanted to be like all the tiktok famous girls who danced, got free products and looked amazing. Their lifestyle seemed to be spotless and
 even tho we were so little and still had our entire childhood left, we wanted to be exactly like them. Now I look back and find it kinda sad that seven year olds wanted to have the same look and life as twentyfive year old grown women who probably edited their pictures and videos. But at that time, they seemed so perfect and it made you question yourself in an unhealthy way. I think that was the first time I started to doubt myself and my own looks, the pressure to be skinny and perfect got put in our head
s as seven years old girls.
A role model can also be great for you, it could be someone who really inspires you and your goals. It could be a person who works with your dreamjob, for an example a rockstar or a writer. If your idol has something you really want and helps you to reach that goal in a healthy way, I think it´s a great way to grow as human. The role model could also be our parents, I can only speak for myself but I think that most of the people recognize themself when I say that our parents we
re the first persons we looked up to. They seemed to always be right and I just assumed that everything they said was correct, that they always wanted my best and that they would always be on my side as a safe place to go. This was in some ways right, I know that my parents will always be there for me but I can´t assume that they magically will fix my life everything something gets hard. That´s not how life works, we have to be our own person at some point and I´ve realized that my parents aren´t perfect. 
My role model isn´t a famous person, an influencer or even my parents. It´s the same person who was with me in first grade when we first started to doubt ourselfs, when life suddenly felt hard and everything got real, my best friend. She has been with me since three years old and we got thru everything together. We´ve shared our life with eachother to the point where it feels like her life is mine and my life is hers. When something great happens to her, Im just as happy as her and when something bad happ
ens, I´m right by her side to give her comfort. My best friend knows me better than anyone and she´s always there for me no matter what. I think that it´s really important to look around and see everything you have and all the persons who cares about instead of always reaching for the 
"perfect" life and the unhealty ideal. Everything and everyone we need is most often around us and your true role model can be closer than you think.

Eng5 NP Writing: Role Models
EK24001@harryda.se
Antal ord: 544
There Is a lot of different kinds of role models nowadays . The ones I've heard of the most are athletes, celebrities and parents, Is your role model one of these? If it they're not what category do they fit in? I think these diffrent kinds are the most popular because of the hope they can give. these people are those who say to never give up on your dreams and always fight, especially parents. Sadly there are a lot of parents who don't push there children to get better and reach for there goals, there are even parents who can't do that. That's why I think the famous people who has a lot of admierers have to really have to keep telling people to reach for their goals and fight for what they want because I think If you really want something bad, you are going to get that.
Role models can change someone very much I would say. They often say things such as "Never give up" or "Always work towards your dreams" which gives you motivation and sometimes dicipline. These things form you as a person, I personally think that If your role model Is a humble and good person you can and will also be that. Role models form our society because every single one that reads this text looks up to someone whether they want to or not. Do you think you look up to a good role model that will change you In a posetive way?
I think most role models have more responsebility than they think and don't always think before acting and I don't think It Is easy knowing you are a role model especially for famous people. But I think that It should be more talked about from the people who know they have a lot of people that admire them.  
My greatest role model is my uncle, I do have a lot of role models and I think that most of you readers also do but my uncle Kalle is the one person I really look up to. Karl August Oppäng called "Kalle" is 23 years old and he lives In sweden gothenburg. Kalle Is one of the few people In my life that always belived In me whatever I wanted to do. He Is also my role model because he fails over and over again till he wins. He never quit and that is why I look up to him. 
I think It Is very important to have a "Kalle" in your life because you never know what life throws at you and It Is important to always have someone who pushes you and brings you motivation. Do you feel like you have a a person like this or maybe you even feel like you are this person.
I think that role models change the world both posetively and negatively. There are people who look up to terorist and there are people who look up to god, very diffrent right? Do you think that you look up to someone that makes you better, smarter or stronger. 
Now that I have said what I think, I want you to think about what makes your role model good or bad and how they have changed you.

requests.essay_b_text:
Eng5 NP Writing: Role Models
ER24004@harryda.se
Antal ord: 355
Role models
A 
roll
 model is someone you look up to, you often let that person influence you and affect you in different ways and sometimes you may not even notice it. A role model can for example be a family member or a famous person. I think everyone has an important role, everyone should always act like a good role model. Do you look up to someone? Who? Why do you look up to that person?
I think the role models people have nowadays is the persons that shows respect to others, someone who has the abillity to influence people and change their opinions to the better. But a lot of people has  someone who stands them close as a role model, like their mother, father, grandparents, or siblings. I would say it's because you've grown up with them, they've shown you how to do things, teached you things that was important then but also is important now, and they've always been your biggest supporters even tho it may not always seem like it. 
Role models influences people in different ways, but if you look up to someone, that person often has a hold on you and is able to affect such things as opinions, attitude and life style, basically how you are as a person and what you do. If your role model dresses in a special way, you may start dressing like that to.
My role model is my grandmother, that's because she's the sweetest, strongest, most caring person i know. She always shows respect to others, and she always puts everyones needs before hers. Everytime you need help or maybe just company, she's there and supports you no matter what. When my grandfather was in the hospital, she would be there for her family, even tho she was the one who needed the support from us. Ever since I was little, she's been by my side, and she's always been, and will always be my best friend.
I hope this text tells you what a role model is, how they matter for people, and how they affect young and older people.
